Not all MEDIN info is reproduced here - this conversion is intended to provide basic information to be reproduced in the NDG/MEDIN discovery service</Short_Name>    </Source_Name>    <ns0:Temporal_Coverage>       <ns0:Start_Date>2014-09-01</ns0:Start_Date>       <ns0:Stop_Date>2014-12-08</ns0:Stop_Date>    </ns0:Temporal_Coverage>    <ns0:Spatial_Coverage>       <ns0:Southernmost_Latitude>51.0672</ns0:Southernmost_Latitude>       <ns0:Northernmost_Latitude>51.8340</ns0:Northernmost_Latitude>       <ns0:Westernmost_Longitude>-3.9840</ns0:Westernmost_Longitude>       <ns0:Easternmost_Longitude>-2.3031</ns0:Easternmost_Longitude>    </ns0:Spatial_Coverage>    <ns0:Data_Center>       <ns0:Data_Center_Name>          <ns0:Short_Name>Plymouth University Marine Institute</ns0:Short_Name>       </ns0:Data_Center_Name>       <ns0:Personnel>          <ns0:Role>originator</ns0:Role>          <ns0:Last_Name>Matthew Ashley</ns0:Last_Name>       </ns0:Personnel>    </ns0:Data_Center>    <ns0:Data_Center>       <ns0:Data_Center_Name>          <ns0:Short_Name>Data Archive for Seabed Species and Habitats (DASSH)</ns0:Short_Name>       </ns0:Data_Center_Name>       <ns0:Personnel>          <ns0:Role>custodian</ns0:Role>          <ns0:Last_Name>Data Manager</ns0:Last_Name>       </ns0:Personnel>    </ns0:Data_Center>    <ns0:Summary>The study aimed to assess and map the delivery of key ecosystem services (ES) within the greater Severn estuary and Bristol Channel. The project aimed to provide a tool for stakeholders, regulators and the marine renewable industry to support decision making in the region. Identification of hotspots for key ES was intended to provide developers with an insight into locations with a high consenting risk.</ns0:Summary>    <ns0:Metadata_Name>9.4</ns0:Metadata_Name>    <ns0:Metadata_Version>[CEOS IDN DIF]</ns0:Metadata_Version>    <ns0:DIF_Creation_Date>2014-12-01</ns0:DIF_Creation_Date> </ns0:DIF>
